Online.Supported: This model has built-in internet search capabilities that perform intensive research using multiple sources
Reasoning.Supported: This model has enhanced reasoning capabilities
FastResponse.Supported: This model is optimized for faster responses
Uncensored.Supported: This model provides raw, unfiltered content without censorship
Murica.Supported: Murica F**k Yeah! This model is finetuned to remove Chinese propaganda and aligned to American values.
ArjunsFavorite.Supported: This model is among Arjun's personal favorites for its exceptional capabilities and open thoughts.
LongContext.Supported: This model supports extremely long context. This can be large documents, books, or even videos.
Agentic.Supported: This model has advanced agentic capabilities for interacting with the world and taking actions
Common.Name: Name
Tooltip.SystemMessage:
The instructions help set the behavior of the assistant. 
For example, you can modify the personality of the assistant or provide specific instructions about how it should behave throughout the conversation. However note that the instructions are optional and the model's behavior without instructions is likely to be similar to using a generic message such as "You are a helpful assistant."
Tooltip.Instructions:
The instructions help set the behavior of the assistant. 
For example, you can modify the personality of the assistant or provide specific instructions about how it should behave throughout the conversation. However note that the instructions are optional and the model's behavior without instructions is likely to be similar to using a generic message such as "You are a helpful assistant."
Prompt.Form.Tooltip.Variable: Variables can be filled in when used, and the syntax for variables is: {{name}}.
Prompt.Form.Example.Variable: Example: 'Write a {{length}} word essay about {{topic}}' creates variables 'length' and 'topic'.
Prompt.Form.Example.SystemVariable: Example: 'You are a {{role}} who specializes in {{expertise}}' creates variables 'role' and 'expertise'.
Prompt.Form.Example.UserVariable: Example: 'Analyze this {{dataType}} data and provide {{analysisType}} insights' creates variables 'dataType' and 'analysisType'.
Prompt.Notifications.MessageRequired: The system message and the user message cannot be empty at the same time.
Prompt.Form.Tooltip.ApplicableModels: Leave it blank if this Task can be applied to all models.

Account.Info.NameRule1: Name can contain Chinese characters, letters (a-z), numbers (0-9), and periods (.).
Account.Info.NameRule2: Name cannot contain an ampersand (&), equals sign (=), underscore (_), apostrophe ('), dash (-), plus sign (+), comma (,), brackets (<,>), or more than one period (.) in a row.
Account.Info.NameRule3: Name can begin or end with non-alphanumeric characters except periods (.).
Account.Info.Agreement: By clicking continue, you agree to our
Account.Info.PasswordRule: Your password must be between 6 and 20 characters and includes both numbers and letters.

Knowledge.OmniBaseDescription: OMNIBase allows your agent to access your knowledge base.

Toolbar.Tip.MaxTokens: Controls how long the AI's response can be. A higher number means longer responses, but it's limited by the model's capabilities. If you need longer responses, try a different model.
Subscription.CIA: Subscribe now to get 100 GPT-4o conversations per day
Common.Author: Author
Tools.Description: This is a series of tools that can extend the functionality of AI models. The purpose is to enable AI models to perform specific tasks or access external resources, thereby enhancing their capabilities and application scope, such as accessing databases, local or network files, etc. Large models that support tool features will decide for themselves whether to use the tools enabled here.
Common.MCPDescription: The Model Context Protocol (MCP) is an open protocol, open-sourced by Anthropic, enabling seamless integration between large language model (LLM) applications and external data sources and tools.
Tool.Info.Empty: Don't deprive your AI of toys! We can build you custom tools, please contact us at arjun@latent-labs.ai
MCP.EditParamsTip: You can still modify other settings for this duplicate server instance.
MCP.ParameterDescription: Incorrect parameters will cause the tool to execute abnormally.
MCP.ImportWarning: Warning: Importing a configuration will overwrite your existing MCP servers. Make sure you have a backup if needed.
MCP.ImportError.InvalidConfig: Invalid MCP configuration. The configuration must contain a servers array.
MCP.ImportError.InvalidServer: Invalid server configuration. Each server must have a key and command.
Tools.PrerequisiteDescription: Available tool servers that can be used by the AI
settings.modelMappingDescription: The purpose of model mapping is to map models to their corresponding names when a request is made. The configuration uses JSON, where the key is the original model name and the value is the mapped model name.
Tool.HowToAddToolsDescription: You can add tools by modifying the configuration file. If changes cause errors and cannot be fixed, simply delete the configuration file. OMNIDesktop will reset it upon the next launch. Feel free to explore!
Tools.KeyHint: The tool's key must be unique, containing only letters (both cases) and numbers, and can't start with a digit.
Tools.DeleteConfirmation: Are you sure you want to delete the tool?
Tools.DeleteConfirmationInfo: Deletion is irreversible. Are you sure you want to continue?
Tools.Name: Name
Common.SupportToolsTip: You can override a model's inherent tool capabilities. The circular badge before each model name visually indicates its tool compatibility status: the outer ring in a shade of gray-green shows the model's original capability, while the inner dot uses the same color gradient to reflect the current configuration setting.
Common.ImportError: Failed to import. Please check your JSON format and try again.
Common.PasteJsonHere: Paste your JSON Task here (multiple Tasks supported)...
Common.DropFileHere: Drop file here or click to browse
Common.NoInspectorData: The model hasn't called any tools yet.
Common.ReferencesInText: References are provided in the text using numbered notation [1], [2], etc.
Common.NoActiveTools: No active tools. Activate tools from the Tools page.
Common.NoActiveServers: No active MCP servers. Go to the Tools page to activate servers.
